newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Union Texas group to boost Venezuala output.
newsitem.headline: Union Texas group to boost Venezuala output.

text.p: A consortium led by Union Texas Petroleum Holdings Inc plans to increase oil production from Venezuela's Boqueron field from 8,500 barrels per day (bpd) to 50,000 bpd in three to five years, a company spokesman said on Friday.
Union Texas has two-thirds of the venture with Germany's Preussag Stahl AG which won a 20-year contract to exploit the field on behalf of Venezuela's state oil company Petroleos de Venezuela (PDVSA).
Trey Wilson, Union Texas's vice president for the Americas, said he expected to invest $100-200 million in the field over the life of the contract.
"We see some deeper exploration potential in the block," he added.
Located in eastern Venezuela, the field has 44 million barrels of proven reserves but this would be expected to rise as the exploration and development programme progresses.
"We chose Venezuela because it has a tremendous hydrocarbon base... we expect this to be the first step for Union Texas in building a core business in Venezuela," Wilson said.
The Union Texas-led consortium won the contract with a bid of $175 million and left Italy's Agip and U.S. Amerada Hess in second place at $90 million.
